abstract.text: A namespace for grouping related AsyncSequence operations.
Retries the upstream
up to a specified number of times while applying a transformation on error.
Introduces a breakpoint into the async sequence.
Shares data from the given cache based on a specified caching strategy and hashable keys.
Type erases the current sequence, useful when you need a concrete type that’s easy to predict.
Executes the current async sequence and returns an AnyCancellable token to cancel the subscription.
Replaces any errors from the upstream
with the provided value.
Logs events from the upstream
to the console.
Raises a fatal error when its upstream sequence fails, and otherwise republishes all received input.
Returns a sequence containing a specific indexed element.
If the sequence finishes normally or with an error before emitting the specified element, then the sequence doesn’t produce any elements.
Retries the upstream
up to a specified number of times.
Tries to catch any errors emitted by the upstream
and handles them using the provided throwing closure.
Shares data from the given cache based on a specified caching strategy and additional context information.
Emits either the first or latest element received during a specified amount of time.
Retries the upstream
up to a specified number of times only when a specific error occurs, while applying a transformation on error.
Shares data from the given cache based on a specified caching strategy and hashable keys.

Returns an async sequence that contains, in order, the elements of the base sequence specified by the range.

and handles them using the provided throwing closure.
